documentation.text: @notice Execution phases of the lottery protocol.
@dev Commitment hashes submitted during the Commit phase.
@dev Revealed values submitted during the Reveal phase.
@dev Tracks whether an address has already committed in the current round.
@dev Tracks whether an address has already revealed in the current round.
@dev List of all addresses that committed in the current round.
@dev List of all addresses that successfully revealed.
@dev Timestamp marking the start of the Commit phase.
@dev Timestamp marking the start of the Reveal phase.
@dev Timestamp marking the end of the lottery round.
@dev Duration of each phase (Commit and Reveal).
@dev Constant flag used for testing and sanity checks.
@notice Winner of the last finalized lottery round.
@notice Number of valid reveals in the last round.
@dev Current protocol phase.

@notice Deploys a new Lottery contract.
 @param p Duration of each phase in seconds.

@notice Starts a new lottery round.
 @dev Initializes timestamps and enters the Commit phase.

statements.documentation: @dev External interaction performed after all checks.

documentation.text:
@notice Returns whether this address corresponds to a contract instance.
 @dev Used for testing and sanity checks.
@notice Returns the start timestamp of the current round.
@notice Returns the reveal phase start timestamp.
@notice Returns the end timestamp of the current round.
@notice Returns the current protocol phase.
@notice Returns the commitment of an address.
@notice Returns the revealed value of an address.
@notice Returns whether an address has committed.
@notice Returns whether an address has revealed.
@notice Returns the number of committed participants.
@notice Returns the committed address at index i.
@notice Returns the number of revealed participants.
@notice Returns the revealed address at index i.

@notice Terminates the current marriage, if any.
 @dev Resets allowance to the baseline value and enforces reciprocal divorce.

@notice Convenience wrapper for reciprocal divorce.
 @dev Uses the caller address as expected spouse.

@notice Increments the age of the taxpayer by one year.
 @dev Updates the minimum allowance if an age threshold is crossed.
@notice Returns the current tax allowance.

@notice Indicates whether the caller is a contract instance.
 @dev Used for defensive checks in cross-contract interactions.
@notice Returns the spouse address, if married.
@notice Indicates whether the taxpayer is currently married.
@notice Lottery instance under test
@notice Test participant harnesses simulating independent users
@dev Stores last random value used by each participant for reveal phase

@notice Deploys the Lottery harness and three Taxpayer harnesses
 @dev Period is fixed to a small value to accelerate phase transitions

@notice Attempts to start the lottery
 @dev Silently ignores reverts to allow arbitrary call ordering

@notice Attempts a reveal action for a participant
 @param who Participant selector

@notice Attempts to finalize the lottery
 @dev Only meaningful after reveal phase

@notice L1 — Commit–reveal binding
 @dev Every revealed value must match its commitment

@notice L2 — No commits before start
 @dev Participants cannot commit before the lottery has started

@notice L3 — Unique reveals
 @dev Each revealed participant appears only once

@notice L4 — Phase correctness
 @dev Phase variables align correctly with the current phase

@notice L5 — Pot balance zero
 @dev The contract balance should be zero at all times

@notice L6 — Winner validity
 @dev If a winner is set, there must be at least one revealed participant

@notice Returns the current spouse address stored in the Taxpayer state.
 @return The spouse address (zero address if not married).

@notice Returns whether the taxpayer is currently marked as married.
 @return True if married, false otherwise.

@notice Returns the current age stored in the Taxpayer state.
 @return The taxpayer age.

commit(bytes32).notice: Submits a commitment for the current lottery round.

endLottery().notice: Finalizes the lottery and selects a winner.

getCommit(address).notice: Returns the commitment of an address.

getCommittedAt(uint256).notice: Returns the committed address at index i.

getCommittedLen().notice: Returns the number of committed participants.

getEndTime().notice: Returns the end timestamp of the current round.

getHasCommitted(address).notice: Returns whether an address has committed.

getHasRevealed(address).notice: Returns whether an address has revealed.

getReveal(address).notice: Returns the revealed value of an address.

getRevealTime().notice: Returns the reveal phase start timestamp.

getRevealedAt(uint256).notice: Returns the revealed address at index i.

getRevealedLen().notice: Returns the number of revealed participants.

getStartTime().notice: Returns the start timestamp of the current round.

isContract().notice: Returns whether this address corresponds to a contract instance.

lastRevealedLen().notice: Number of valid reveals in the last round.

lastWinner().notice: Winner of the last finalized lottery round.

reveal(uint256).notice: Reveals the previously committed secret value.

userdoc.notice: Implements a time-based commit–reveal lottery protocol.

commit(bytes32).details: Callable only during the Commit phase and only once per address.

params.y: keccak256 hash of the secret value to be revealed later.

params.p: Duration of each phase in seconds.

endLottery().details: Computes the winner deterministically and resets all per-round state.

isContract().details: Used for testing and sanity checks.

reveal(uint256).details: Callable only during the Reveal phase and only if a valid commit exists.

params.rev: Original secret used to generate the commitment.

startLottery().details: Initializes timestamps and enters the Commit phase.

devdoc.details: The contract focuses on protocol correctness and state safety,      not on cryptographic randomness quality.
devdoc.title: Commit–Reveal Lottery

constructor.notice: Initializes a taxpayer with parent references.

divorce().notice: Terminates the current marriage, if any.

divorceBack(address).notice: Completes the reciprocal side of a divorce.

getIsMarriedForSSA().notice: Indicates whether the taxpayer is currently married.

getSpouseForSSA().notice: Returns the spouse address, if married.

haveBirthday().notice: Increments the age of the taxpayer by one year.

isContract().notice: Indicates whether the caller is a contract instance.

marry(address).notice: Establishes a marriage with another Taxpayer contract.

marryBack(address).notice: Completes the reciprocal side of a marriage.

revealLottery(address,uint256).notice: Reveals the committed value to the Lottery.

transferAllowance(uint256).notice: Transfers part of the tax allowance to the spouse.

userdoc.notice: Models family relationships and tax allowance logic.

constructor.details: Tax allowance is initialized to the baseline value.

divorce().details: Resets allowance to the baseline value and enforces reciprocal divorce.

divorceBack().details: Uses the caller address as expected spouse.

divorceBack(address).details: Callable only by the spouse contract to maintain consistency.

haveBirthday().details: Updates the minimum allowance if an age threshold is crossed.

isContract().details: Used for defensive checks in cross-contract interactions.

joinLottery(address,uint256).details: Stores the secret locally for later reveal.

marryBack(address).details: Callable only by the spouse contract to ensure atomic updates.

setTaxAllowance(uint256).details: Callable only by trusted contracts (Taxpayer or Lottery).      Enforces a minimum baseline allowance.

transferAllowance(uint256).details: Allowed only between mutually married taxpayers.

devdoc.details: Designed for security analysis using property-based fuzzing (Echidna).      Focuses on state consistency, allowance conservation, and safe interactions      with the Lottery contract.
devdoc.title: Taxpayer Contract

act_commit(uint8,uint256).notice: Attempts a commit action for a participant

act_reveal(uint8).notice: Attempts a reveal action for a participant

constructor.notice: Deploys the Lottery harness and three Taxpayer harnesses

userdoc.notice: Echidna property-based fuzzing harness for the Lottery contract.

act_start(uint8).details: Silently ignores reverts to allow arbitrary call ordering

constructor.details: Period is fixed to a small value to accelerate phase transitions

echidna_L1_binding().details: Every revealed value must match its commitment

echidna_L2_no_commit_when_not_started().details: Participants cannot commit before the lottery has started

echidna_L3_unique_reveals().details: Each revealed participant appears only once

echidna_L4_phase_correctness().details: Phase variables align correctly with the current phase

echidna_L5_pot_balance_zero().details: The contract balance should be zero at all times

echidna_L6_winner_validity().details: If a winner is set, there must be at least one revealed participant

devdoc.details: This contract drives arbitrary interactions against LotteryHarness      and checks protocol-level safety invariants.
devdoc.title: Echidna_Lottery

endLottery().notice: Finalizes the lottery and selects a winner.

userdoc.notice: Echidna testing harness for the Lottery contract

commit(bytes32).details: Callable only during the Commit phase and only once per address.

params.y: keccak256 hash of the secret value to be revealed later.

constructor.details: The constructor simply forwards the parameter to the base Lottery contract.

params.p: Duration (in seconds) of each lottery phase (commit and reveal)

endLottery().details: Computes the winner deterministically and resets all per-round state.

isContract().details: Used for testing and sanity checks.

reveal(uint256).details: Callable only during the Reveal phase and only if a valid commit exists.

params.rev: Original secret used to generate the commitment.

startLottery().details: Initializes timestamps and enters the Commit phase.

devdoc.details: This contract exposes the Lottery logic unchanged and is used exclusively      for property-based fuzzing with Echidna. No additional state or behavior      is introduced beyond the inherited contract.
devdoc.title: LotteryHarness

constructor.notice: Deploys the harness by initializing the underlying Taxpayer contract.

divorce().notice: Terminates the current marriage, if any.

divorceBack(address).notice: Completes the reciprocal side of a divorce.

getAge().notice: Returns the current age stored in the Taxpayer state.

getIsMarried().notice: Returns whether the taxpayer is currently marked as married.

getIsMarriedForSSA().notice: Indicates whether the taxpayer is currently married.

getSpouse().notice: Returns the current spouse address stored in the Taxpayer state.

getSpouseForSSA().notice: Returns the spouse address, if married.

haveBirthday().notice: Increments the age of the taxpayer by one year.

isContract().notice: Indicates whether the caller is a contract instance.

marry(address).notice: Establishes a marriage with another Taxpayer contract.

marryBack(address).notice: Completes the reciprocal side of a marriage.

revealLottery(address,uint256).notice: Reveals the committed value to the Lottery.

transferAllowance(uint256).notice: Transfers part of the tax allowance to the spouse.

userdoc.notice: Echidna harness that exposes internal Taxpayer state via getters for invariant testing.

params.p1: First address used to initialize Taxpayer state.
params.p2: Second address used to initialize Taxpayer state.

divorce().details: Resets allowance to the baseline value and enforces reciprocal divorce.

divorceBack().details: Uses the caller address as expected spouse.

divorceBack(address).details: Callable only by the spouse contract to maintain consistency.

haveBirthday().details: Updates the minimum allowance if an age threshold is crossed.

isContract().details: Used for defensive checks in cross-contract interactions.

joinLottery(address,uint256).details: Stores the secret locally for later reveal.

marryBack(address).details: Callable only by the spouse contract to ensure atomic updates.

setTaxAllowance(uint256).details: Callable only by trusted contracts (Taxpayer or Lottery).      Enforces a minimum baseline allowance.

transferAllowance(uint256).details: Allowed only between mutually married taxpayers.

devdoc.details: This contract inherits Taxpayer and adds view-only helpers; it must not modify the core logic.
devdoc.title: TaxpayerHarness
